Class Door

  • java.lang.Object
    • Renderable
      • ImageBox
        • OnGrid
          • Cell
            • Door
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColouredDoor, TokenDoor

    public abstract class Door
extends Cell
    A class that represents a door that can tried to be opened when stepped on by a player, moving them back if they couldn't open it.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Ajaya Budhathoki, Josiah Richards

    • Constructor Detail

      • Door

        public Door(Map map)
        Creates a door object for a map. Doesn't add the door to the map!
        Parameters:
        map - The map(grid) this object is on.

    • Method Detail

      • getSymbol

        public char getSymbol()
        Description copied from class: Cell
        Gets the character, if any, thats used to represent this cell in a file.
        Overrides:
        getSymbol in class Cell
        Returns:
        The character that represents this cell in a file, defaults to a space.

      • stepOn

        public void stepOn(Moving steppedOnBy,
                   Direction movedDir)
        Steps on this door to try and open it.
        Overrides:
        stepOn in class OnGrid
        Parameters:
        steppedOnBy - The moving object that stepped on this object.
        movedDir - The direction the moving object moved to step on this.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Opens the door by replacing the Cell at its coordinates with a Ground Cell.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If the ground sprite is invalid.

      • tryToOpen

        public abstract boolean tryToOpen(Player player)
        Checks to see if a player can open this door. This is called try to open instead of check because it may affect the player e.g. consume keys e.c.t. and so it's not repeatable like a check function.
        Parameters:
        player - The player trying to open this door.
        Returns:
        If the player can open this door(true) or not(false).
